intro: Echium tuberculatum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a waxy coating, and the plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental uses. This variety is distinguished by its broader foliage compared to other echium species.
